stimulusHtml: Which of the following is an example of a density-independent limitation on a population?
choicesHtml: In larger population densities of rabbits, the percentage of rabbits infected with bacteria is greater.
At greater concentrations of bacteria, nutrient supplies diminish and population growth ceases.
At higher temperatures, more tomato plants in a population become infested with nematodes than at lower temperatures.
In denser stands of oak trees, greater percentages of trees are attacked by gypsy moths than in less dense stands.
Once the population of grouse exceeds a certain number, the predation rate becomes very high.
